intro: Strychnos minor var. thorelii, commonly known as the African snakeroot, is a small evergreen shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are toxic to humans and animals. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its toxic properties, it is not typically cultivated for ornamental or medicinal purposes.
